result.execSummary:
The defendant EVAN D ROSS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. EVAN D ROSS

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant EVAN D ROSS in court.  Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for EVAN D ROSS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Ceman, matter is resolved, State will be amending count 1 to misdemeanor Battery and defendant will enter a plea to both counts with probation. ADA concurs with costs and other conditions. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 1 Battery and count 2 DC. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Ceman. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1 / Count 2 - EACH:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the first year of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.  

Court is not opposed to early termination but does not say he will grant it.

Court adjourned at 2:25 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return date on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No Contact with the victim CJN or their residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with the victim CJN or their residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:19 AM Defendant EVAN D ROSS in court.  Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for EVAN D ROSS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ceman confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and will waive the prelim. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim - CJN. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant will waive the prelim. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Ceman. Attorney Ceman acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Ceman enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:23 AM
